Articles.Content:
Because I have always had an interest in Soviet/Russian space stations and the only ones out there are the MIR (by Bobcat) and the Salyut in the Kosmos pack. So I decided that it would be a nice idea to make replicas of each Salyut (from 1-7) as a whole piece (except docking ports and solar panels). And once I've made them (if anyone is interested in this) then I will go on to make interiors for each of them.

Psycho529

http://imgur.com/a/GEwHj

Salyut-1 so far...
Looking good, I'll definitely download when done!
Very nice. Consider using Soyuz solar panels from BobCat's pack, as the first Salyut stations used the same panels as Soyuz.
Yeah that's what I was planning on doing and then using the Salyut panels from the Kosmos pack for the other versions of the Salyut.
Should I make the DOS-2? (considering the fact that it never got into orbit because the second stage of the Proton rocket failed)

http://imgur.com/a/GEwHj

Some minor adjustments to the Salyut-1 and airlock added.

Should I make the DOS-2? (considering the fact that it never got into orbit because the second stage of the Proton rocket failed)

You're doing it already, it was identical to DOS-1.
Technically speaking it wasn't, just a few things that aren't really noticeable, but other than that yes it is the same

http://imgur.com/a/GEwHj

More progress... Salyut-1 is complete for now (IVA and extra stuff on exterior will be added at a later date). Now I'm working on Salyut-2 (OPS-1)... oh what fun...

Edited June 30, 2013 by Psycho529
Im excited! I take it youre adopting the ~64% scale thing that a lot of modders use?

Use

Javascript is disabled. View full album
tags to put albums in posts.

http://imgur.com/a/GEwHj

More progress... Salyut-1 is complete for now (IVA and extra stuff on exterior will be added at a later date).

Oh wow. This is finished? I hope you have a good reason for all those rectangles otherwise you seriously need to optimise this model.
Finished the Salyut-2 model... http://imgur.com/a/GEwHj

Oh wow. This is finished? I hope you have a good reason for all those rectangles otherwise you seriously need to optimise this model.

It's not quite finished, still a bit of work to do on it and those rectangles were for small details and stuff on the side of the Salyut... I will see what I can do to reduce the unnecessary ones

OMG.

Dude! Do you have something against low-end machines? Look at the polycount on that thing. I swear no self respecting artist would call that "finished". You literally have hundreds of unnecessary faces there.

Edit. Don't extrude details. Just put separate objects on top.

Edit 2. You really should redo this. Better to do it now, since you've just started.

Edited June 30, 2013 by Cpt. Kipard

http://imgur.com/a/GEwHj#olO7JnA

Now with about 80-90% less rectangles!
Looking good!

OMG.

Dude! Do you have something against low-end machines? Look at the polycount on that thing. I swear no self respecting artist would call that "finished". You literally have hundreds of unnecessary faces there.

Edit. Don't extrude details. Just put separate objects on top.

Edit 2. You really should redo this. Better to do it now, since you've just started.

If I restarted now then I will go psycho from the amount of time I will be throwing in the bin... especially when I can easily reduce the polycount on them...

Edited June 30, 2013 by Psycho529
It's OK It looks *much* better now. good job.
I'm having to remake the part that had the insane amounts of rectangles... just so it doesn't screw up the game

It's OK It looks *much* better now. good job.

Thanks, just wait until I'm done with the one with the insane amount of rectangles, you'll be glad I did remake that 1 part of the space station.

http://imgur.com/a/GEwHj#tgNdrqw

Now with TONS of rectangles removed
Just done the Cosmos 557 (just took the Salyut-1 model and made some minor adjustments)
